0.text: Bug 41347  CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection.

1.text: If you drop down the combo list using the mouse and then select an entry using the mouse, the CCombo fires a defaultSelection.

3.text: It should fire a selection instead.

4.text: Default selection means something was selected and you should go and do something.

5.text: The typical reaction is to process the selection and dismiss the dialog.

6.text: A combo shouldn't fire default selection from just selecting an entry in the dropdown.

7.text: A typical user of a combobox would be vert surprised to have the dialog be dismissed just because the entry was selected.

9.text: Because of this you can't tell the difference between just selecting an entry using the mouse and hitting enter from the text field of the CCombo.

10.text: Hitting enter from the text field should be treated as default selection.
